{{Superherobox| image= |caption= |character_name=Strobe |real_name=Juliana WorthingOfficial Handbook of the Marvel Universe A-Z hardcover Vol. 8, MLF entry |species=[[Mutant (Marvel Comics)|Human Mutant]] |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''New Mutants'' #86 (February 1990) |creators= |alliances=[[Mutant Liberation Front]] |aliases= |powers=Depowered, formerly:
Heat/light generation, |}} '''Strobe''' is a fictional [[Mutant (Marvel Comics)|mutant]] character appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. She was created for the villainous team the [[Mutant Liberation Front]] (MLF). ==Publication history== Strobe made her first appearance in ''[[New Mutants]]'' #86. However, in this issue she appears in only one panel, with her face obscured, and is not identified, though one of her teammates, [[Tempo (comics)|Tempo]], is incorrectly addressed as "Strobe". Her first full appearance is in ''New Mutants'' #87. ==Fictional character biography== The [[Mutant Liberation Front]] (MLF), including Strobe, first came on the scene to demand the liberation of two incarcerated mutants, [[Skids (comics)|Skids]] and [[Rusty Collins]]. They destroy an energy plant as proof of their convictions. The group tries to free them by force, but this only ends in confusion. During the break-in, [[Cable (comics)|Cable]] tries to intervene and a prison guard accidentally shoots Rusty. Skids believes that it was Cable who shot her friend, so she decides to side with the MLF.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} The New Mutants track the team down to [[Madripoor]] and get in a few conflicts with them. Even with the help of [[Sunfire (comics)|Sunfire]], the MLF manages to capture several of the New Mutants. However, their victory is short-lived with the arrival of [[Wolverine (character)|Wolverine]] who helps the teens liberate their [[kidnap]]ped friends. But before the MLF can be caught, they [[Teleportation|teleport]] to safety.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} Strobe next appears with an MLF strike force who attempt to break [[Nasty Boys]] members [[Slab (comics)|Slab]] and [[Hairbag]] out of prison. They succeed and then set their eyes on destroying the Tucker clinic, however they are thwarted by [[X-Factor (comics)|X-Factor]] who had been tipped off by MLF member [[Tempo (comics)|Tempo]]. With their leader almost being captured, the MLF once more escapes to freedom.''X-Factor'' #77-78 (1992) As the events of the ''[[X-Cutioner's Song]]'' begin to unfold, the MLF finds itself collecting an array of ancient [[relic]]s. The team, including Strobe, split into strike forces to steal the various artifacts that will help [[Apocalypse (comics)|Apocalypse]] from his slumber. Later on, in ''X-Factor #85'', the New Mutants, [[X-Factor (comics)|X-Factor]] and the [[X-Men]] discover the latest MLF base in Dust Bowl, [[Arkansas]]. After an intense battle, all member of the MLF are captured and taken into custody, though Strobe severely damages Rogue's eyesight, resulting in a long recovery.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} In the wake of [[Decimation (comics)|M-Day]]—an event in which a [[mentally ill]] [[Scarlet Witch]] depowered over 90% of the mutant population—Strobe was shown to be one of the many who lost her powers (revealed in ''[[The New Avengers (comics)|New Avengers]]'' #18). ==Powers and abilities== Strobe formerly had the ability to project heat and light blasts capable of blinding, scorching, or melting opponents and objects, and create energy shields. ==In other media== ===Television=== * Strobe appears in the ''[[X-Men: The Animated Series|X-Men]]'' episode "Secrets Not Long Buried". She is one of the many residents of the mutant-dominated community of Skull Mesa. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.uncannyxmen.net/db/characters/showquestion.asp?fldAuto=1022 Uncannyxmen.net character bio on Strobe] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060102144405/http://www.uncannyxmen.net/db/pov/showquestion.asp?faq=5&fldAuto=46 Uncannyxmen.net feature on the MLF] {{DEFAULTSORT:Strobe (Comics)}} [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1990]] [[Category:Fictional characters with fire or heat abilities]] [[Category:Marvel Comics female supervillains]] [[Category:Marvel Comics mutants]]
